Package fr.utt.lo02.projet.model.player

Real and virtual players with their requests A Virtual player is a player following a strategy to do his choices. A real one holds his cards and scores (and thus doesn't represent the real user). The players are using (Move/Place)Requests to ask the game to make a movement or a placement.
  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    MoveRequest
    Represents a move request from a player.
    PlaceRequest
    Represents a place request from a player.
    Player
    Represents a player with all his characteristics and his actions.
    RealPlayer
    Represents a real player.
    VirtualPlayer
    Represents a virtual player (It uses a predefined strategy: random or difficult).
  • Enum Summary
    Enum Description
    Choice
    Lists the 3 possibilities of choice for a player in each turn: he can move, place or end his turn.
  • Exception Summary
    Exception Description
    PlayerHandEmptyException
    Represents an exception when the hand of one player is empty without explainations.
